website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for having SPD-style cleats without paying a premium price.
pros: Pedals offer the same basic clip-in riding experience as more expensive options
The design is small and compact so bikes are easier to carry and store
cons: Body of the pedals is heavier than the more common premium versions
Can be difficult to unclip and get out of pedals

customer_reviews.title: These are great SPD pedals at the $30 price point!!
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great for the $30 price point. I put 1300 miles on them last year (my brand new road bike), not a single problem. I simply lubed the pivots with bike chain lube and wipe them clean. You have to take of your machines if you expect them to perform, yes this is machine!. I'm buying another pair for my wife's new bike today. Clip in/out operations are very dependable, never experienced any problems. I actually have the same pedals on my Triathlon bike and did a full Ironman and well as 2 half Ironmans and they have held up great! No need to spend hundreds on fancy pedals and shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bueckers

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for the Peloton bike
customer_reviews.text: One pedal broke off of the welded portion within the first three months. They are recommended by Peloton (for their Peloton Bike) if you want to switch out to SPD's. These pedals are not strong enough to withstand the intensity of the workouts and I've been riding/spinning for over 10 years. I went to my local cycle shop and purchased a stronger pair (at 4 times the price) and it was a better fit for me. The seller did get back with me right away but I told my cycle shop to throw away the broken pedal. So I could not provide a picture of the broken pedal for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: viktoria

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are great, and fits perfect at my new indoor spin bike :)
customer_reviews.author: Gina Brazil

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: Pedals are working great with no issues to date. I have a few hundred miles on these and have been through dust, dirt, and mud with no discernible wear. The adjustment is easy and provides a good range, just make sure to remember the "turns" out so that both sides of the pedal and bike are equal.
customer_reviews.author: JDZ

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!! Simple to put on
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to put on. I thought they wouldn’t stay on because there’s nothing to tighten them in. But after a month. I have no problems whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: DUFF-STUFF

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bough these pedals for my new spin bike like some of the reviews show. When I got the pedals, right on the box they said “NOT FOR USE ON INDOOR BIKES”. I sent them back, as this warning was not at all clear before ordering them. Then they charged a 20% restocking fee upon return! Bad advertising which made me lose money in the end.

customer_reviews.text: Tensioner spring for one of the spd clips (1 of 4) broke after 2 rides. Yes 2 rides (arm snapped off), and I am a true amateur (once a year) rider.

customer_reviews.title: outstanding quality, great value pricing
customer_reviews.text: outstandin quality at a value price. chromed hardware hasnt chipped or scratched and is a nice option to just flat black. just the right amount of float for my pedal stroke. if u want more rigid fixation look to a 3 bolt style pedal/cleat not these Shimano equivalent SPD's.
